TopicTitle: Are we in a holding pattern?

Articles.Content:
This may be just me, but it seems activity has lessened in the forum.  To be fair, I mostly hover around the Challenges, and I have noticed they are coming less frequently than they used to. More importantly, I see challenges being made, but few actual entries.  I used to put up challenges regularly, and there was a core of gamers who jumped on them. Likewise, those same players, often presented challenges as well and I always enjoyed participating.  There is just something odd about having a challenge up for nearly half a day, and not one response.

I wonder if we are in a holding pattern in which folks are drifting away as the release of KSP2 draws closer, or (or perhaps in addition) the past few years have made real life demonstrably harder and other priorities have taken over.   Or is it just over time folks come and go, and the members I saw regularly have drifted away, to be replaced by new ones?  I can think of several folks that seem to have drifted away. I have never known them other than avatars, but I hope they are all doing okay.

 

 

Edited November 8, 2022 by Klapaucius

36 minutes ago, Klapaucius said:

the past few years have made real life demonstrably harder and other priorities have taken over. 

I haven't been on the forums long, but I have noticed somewhat of a downtick in activity since I joined in April of this year.

12 hours ago, Klapaucius said:

Or is it just over time folks come and go, and the members I saw regularly have drifted away, to be replaced by new ones?

I suspect that the growth parts of previous cycles of turnover were partly driven by marketing of new releases of KSP1, with new people hearing about it, buying it, and joining the forum. For a while now, all the new development and marketing has been for a sequel that you can't buy, so that pipeline is blocked. I expect an uptick of activity when KSP2 goes into early access in February.

Aaaand: As far as I saw Ksp2: The graphics of a heavily modded ksp1 install is mostly as good as (in some parts even better) what Ksp2 will look at release. At least what I saw of KSP2 yet. 

For me: no need to switch to ksp2 before end of the early access phase. Maybe even later, if even at all. There is so much to do in KSP1, that I simply do not need the switch right at the start. For that, i'd be happy if the mods would still get some bugfix (not feature incrementing) support.
